responses: Chemical Formula of Oxygen is O₂
Chemical Formula of Water is H₂O
Chemical Formula of Hydrogen is H₂
Chemical Formula of Carbon dioxide is CO₂
Chemical Formula of Methane is CH₄
Chemical Formula of Ammonia is NH₃
Chemical Formula of Sodium chloride (table salt) is NaCl
Chemical Formula of salt is NaCl
Chemical Formula of Sulfuric acid is H₂SO₄
Chemical Formula of Nitric acid is HNO₃
Chemical Formula of Glucose is C₆H₁₂O₆
Chemical Formula of Ethanol is C₂H₅OH
Chemical Formula of Carbon monoxide is CO
Chemical Formula of Sulfur dioxide is SO₂
Chemical Formula of Hydrochloric acid is HCl
Chemical Formula of Methanol is CH₃OH

patterns: What is Newtons First law
What is Newtons Second law
What is Third law
What is Law of universal gravitation
What is Law of conservation of energy
What is Law of conservation of mass
What is Electromagnetism or Maxwell's Equations
What is The First Law of Thermodynamics
What is The Second Law of Thermodynamics
What is Boyle's Law
What is Ohm's law
What is Charles's Law
responses: Newtons first law states that an object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an external force.
Newtons second law states that the force acting on an object is equal to the mass of that object multiplied by its acceleration (F = ma).
Newtons third law states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

Law of universal gravitation states that every point mass attracts every other point mass in the universe with a force that is directly proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between their centers.
Law of conservation of energy states that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transferred or converted from one form to another.
Law of conservation of mass states that in a chemical reaction, the total mass of the reactants is equal to the total mass of the products.
Electromagnetism or Maxwell's Equations is a set of four fundamental equations describing how electric and magnetic fields interact.
The First Law of Thermodynamics states that energy cannot be created or destroyed in an isolated system.
The Second Law of Thermodynamics introduces the concept of entropy, stating that the total entropy of an isolated system can never decrease over time.

Ohm's law states that the current passing through a conductor between two points is directly proportional to the voltage across the two points and inversely proportional to the resistance between them (V = IR).
Boyle's Law states that the pressure of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume at constant temperature.
Charles's Law states that the volume of a gas is directly proportional to its temperature at constant pressure.
